intro: Melinis pulchra, commonly known as the purple threeawn, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear bristly, purple-tinted seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Melinis pulchra is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its rapid growth and seed dispersal make it an invasive species in some regions.
